job description:
Job Summary:

Performs the following types of duties: recommends, specifies, and evaluates proposed new materials; assists in batch failure analysis and effective solution implementation; participates in interdepartmental improvement activities; communicates and coordinates all project activities; operates and maintains formulation lab equipment; maintains proper documentation and keeps accurate records of all work; performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Summary:
  • Ensures records regarding formulas, specifications, are correct in Oracle and Agile
  • Evaluates documentation of new and existing materials
  • Documents processes
  • Reviews and analyzes QA data
  • Manages and communicates project activities
  • Reviews departmental SOPs for accuracy
  • Submits proper documentation for label creation and regulatory compliance
  • Maintains proper documentation and keeps accurate records of all work
  • Works effectively with multiple departments to complete projects
  • Conducts departmental orientation
  • Performs other related duties as assigned
Requirements:
  • Experience with CFR Title 21
  • Knowledge of microbiology, formula structure, lab procedures, and testing methodology
  • Knowledge of GMP regulations
  • Vendor relations experience
  • Knowledge in herbal and nutritional science preferred
  • Basic math skills
  • Experience with data analysis
  • Experience managing multiple tasks
  • Strong organizational skills
  • BS in applicable science field, e.g., food science, nutritional science, chemistry, biology
